snippet: The change in Mitt Romney’s fortune in the last two weeks has led to more talk among market strategists about the influence the election is exerting on the markets.
abstract: Change in Mitt Romney’s fortune in last two weeks on campaign trail and in polls has led to more talk among market strategists about the influence the election is exerting on markets; many economists worry that Romney's ascension has been a drag on the markets due to his opposition to the Federal Reserve's efforts to aid the economy with monetary stimulus.
lead_paragraph: The change in Mitt Romney’s fortune in the last two weeks has led to more talk among market strategists about the influence the election is exerting on the markets.

headline.seo: Debating the Election’s Cause and Effect on Wall Street
headline.main: Which Changed First, the Polls or the Markets?
headline.print_headline: Which Changed First, The Polls or the Markets?
